item.title: Example Talk
item.description:
Click on the Slides button above to view the built-in slides feature.

Slides can be added in a few ways:

  • Create slides using Wowchemy’s Slides feature and link using slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file
  • Upload an existing slide deck to static/ and link using url_slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file
  • Embed your slides (e.g. Google Slides) or presentation video on this page using shortcodes.

Further event details, including page elements such as image galleries, can be added to the body of this page.

item.title: The Energy Efficiency Improvement Strategy of Chillers Using Artificial Neural Network Algorithms
Research on Electronic Expansion Valve and Compressor Liquid Floodback Fault Diagnosis Based on Deep Transfer Learning
Research on Electronic Expansion Valve and Compressor Liquid Floodback Fault Diagnosis Based on Deep Transfer Learning
Energy Consumption Prediction of R&F Wanda Realm Hotel in State Grid Based on Deep Learning Algorithm
Monologue
item.description: I am an optimistic and cheerful person, I like to make friends with different people, I like to experience projects and games that I have not played before, and keep my enthusiasm and curiosity about life. As Pushkin said, “If life deceives you, donâ€™t be sad, everything will pass, and what has passed will become cordial nostalgia.” Now, as a student and researcher, I work in the School of Energy and Power Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology. As an engineer, I need to treat our projects with a rigorous attitude. Therefore, I need to invest more time in the laboratory. Therefore, I often adhere to the rhythm of life from coming to work very early to going back to rest very late. In addition to being a researcher, I am also a member of the Red Cross. I will often play with mentally handicapped children so that they can experience more fun; I will also go to the stray cat and dog base to be a responsible “shovel”. Shiguan"; I also participated in various first aid training, and held first aid training activities, popular science first aid knowledge, helping others is my pleasure, because “giving someone a rose, the hand has a lingering fragrance.” To be an ideal scientific researcher is my pursuit. Of course, life also needs adjustment. Outside of research, I am an outgoing person and it is easy to get along with others. I have various hobbies, such as running, cycling, Tai Chi, fitness, jazz, singing, etc.

item.title: Load Forecasting Control Method and System Of Chiller Based On Side-Cloud Collaborative Framework
item.description: The invention discloses a chiller load forecasting control method and system based on a side-cloud collaborative framework, and belongs to the field of optimized control. The present invention proposes a hierarchical optimization control of chillers using edge computing and cloud computing integration. Real-time load forecasting and division and data preprocessing at the edge, control parameter matrix under different load rates, training and updating of load forecasting models and energy consumption fitting models in the cloud, optimization of chiller control parame ters, using the corresponding models to pass intelligence The optimization algorithm seeks the input of the minimum value of the adaptive function to obtain the optimal control parameter combination. The invention makes full use of edge end resources for data preprocessing and control parameter matrix storage and control parameter transmission, reduces cloud computing pressure and reduces the impact of data transmission delay, so as to achieve the effect of rapid real-time update and optimization control, and can better Fitting the actual operating data, under the condition of meeting the basic load, significantly reducing the energy consumption of the entire system.

item.title: Data-Driven Fault Diagnosis For Residential Variable Refrigerant Flow System On Imbalanced Data Environments
Research on Fault Diagnosis of Compressor Liquid Floodback Based on Deep Neural Network Algorithm

Supplementary notes can be added here, including code, math, and images.

item.title: The Influence of Different Climatic Regions On The Energy Efficiency Standard Index of VRF System
Research On Energy Efficiency of Office Buildings VRF System In China
Energy Consumption Prediction of R&F Wanda Realm Hotel in State Grid Based on Deep Learning Algorithm
item.description: Use DBN algorithm to predict hotel energy consumption, and cuckoo search algorithm to optimize. Finally, the average absolute error is 1.05, the mean square error is 1.36, and the coefficient of determination is 0.98.

item.title: State Key Laboratory of Compressor Technology Open Fund(No.SKL-YSJ201801)
Optimization Analysis of Training Data for Fault Diagnosis of Refrigeration System Based On Dynamic Recognition and Cluster Analysis(No.51576074)
item.description: The use of deep learning models can detect liquid return failures more efficiently, with an accuracy rate of 99.86%; Compared with the decision tree model with supervised algorithm, there is no need for correlation analysis and pruning process. Compared with the cluster analysis algorithm model of unsupervised algorithm, there is no need for correlation and principal component analysis process. The processing process is simple and easy to operate and efficient; Use Keras to build a deep neural network model; Compared with support vector machines, neural networks, and random forest algorithms, the process of building deep neural network models is simple and efficient;

item.title: Research on the Fault Diagnosis Method of Refrigeration and Air Conditioning Based on Pattern Recognition and Integrated Learning Under the Framework of Big Data(No.51876070)

item.title: Slides
item.description:
Create slides in Markdown with Wowchemy

Wowchemy | Documentation

Features

  • Efficiently write slides in Markdown
  • 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides
  • Supports speaker notes
  • Mobile friendly slides

Controls

  • Next: Right Arrow or Space
  • Previous: Left Arrow
  • Start: Home
  • Finish: End
  • Overview: Esc
  • Speaker notes: S
  • Fullscreen: F
  • Zoom: Alt + Click
  • PDF Export: E

Code Highlighting

Inline code: variable

Code block:

porridge = "blueberry"
if porridge == "blueberry":
    print("Eating...")

Math

In-line math: $x + y = z$

Block math:

$$ f\left( x \right) = ;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$

Fragments

Make content appear incrementally

{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}}
{{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}}
{{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}}

Press Space to play!

One Two Three

A fragment can accept two optional parameters:

  • class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS)
  • weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears

Speaker Notes

Add speaker notes to your presentation

{{% speaker_note %}}
- Only the speaker can read these notes
- Press `S` key to view
{{% /speaker_note %}}

Press the S key to view the speaker notes!

  • Only the speaker can read these notes
  • Press S key to view

Themes

  • black: Black background, white text, blue links (default)
  • white: White background, black text, blue links
  • league: Gray background, white text, blue links
  • beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links
  • sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links
  • night: Black background, thick white text, orange links
  • serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links
  • simple: White background, black text, blue links
  • solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links

Custom Slide

Customize the slide style and background

{{< slide background-image="/media/boards.jpg" >}}
{{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}}
{{< slide class="my-style" >}}

Custom CSS Example

Let’s make headers navy colored.

Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:

.reveal section h1,
.reveal section h2,
.reveal section h3 {
  color: navy;
}

Questions?

Ask

Documentation

item.title: A Waste Heat-Driven Absorption Refrigeration Auxiliary Subcooled CO2 Automobile Air Conditioner
item.description: The invention discloses a CO2 automobile air conditioner with waste heat driven absorption refrigeration and auxiliary subcooling. The high-temperature tail gas exhaust pipe of the internal combustion engine of the present invention is connected to the generator, the refrigerant vapor outlet of the generator, the condenser, the throttle valve one, and the refrigerant inlet of the evaporator one are connected in sequence, and the refrigerant outlet of the evaporator one, the absorber, and the The solution pump and the solution inlet of the heat exchanger are connected in sequence, and the solution outlet of the heat exchanger is connected to the generator; the refrigerant outlet of the generator is connected to the refrigerant inlet of the heat exchanger, and the refrigerant outlet of the heat exchanger is connected to the absorber through the second throttle valve. ; The compressor outlet is connected to the throttle valve through the gas cooler and connected to the compressor inlet. The present invention is to cool the CO2 at the outlet of the gas cooler, the evaporation temperature of which is higher, higher than the evaporation temperature of the CO2 system, and the two systems are coordinated and matched with each other to jointly improve the overall efficiency of the cycle.

item.title: CO2 Marine Refrigeration System With Subcooling Assisted By Absorption and Thermoelectric Refrigeration
item.description: The invention discloses a CO2 marine refrigeration system with absorption and thermoelectric refrigeration in cooperation with auxiliary subcooling. The solution outlet of the absorber of the present invention is connected to the solution inlet of the generator through a solution pump, the refrigerant vapor outlet of the generator is connected to the second refrigerant inlet of the evaporator through a condenser and a pressure reducing valve, and the second refrigerant outlet of the evaporator is connected to the absorber; The absorber is connected through a throttle valve; the compressor outlet, gas cooler, thermoelectric subcooler, evaporator two, expander and evaporator one inlet are connected in sequence, and the evaporator one outlet is connected to the compressor inlet; the power manager is connected to the expansion separately Machine and thermoelectric supercooler. The invention can cool the CO2 at the outlet of the gas cooler by recycling the waste heat and pressure, is easy to realize, and can reduce its temperature below the ambient temperature, and can significantly reduce the irreversible loss in the high-pressure CO2 throttling process

item.title: A CO2 Automobile Air-Conditioning System Based On Waste Heat And Pressure Combined With Auxiliary Subcooling
item.description: The invention discloses a CO2 automobile air conditioning system based on waste heat and pressure combined with auxiliary subcooling. The CO2 automobile air conditioning system of the present invention includes a compressor, an evaporator, a gas cooler, a throttle valve, a thermoelectric generator, a thermoelectric subcooler, a thermoelectric generator and an engine; the evaporator outlet is connected to the compressor inlet, and the compressor outlet is connected to gas cooling The inlet of the gas cooler and the outlet of the gas cooler are connected to the inlet of the thermoelectric subcooler, the outlet of the thermoelectric subcooler is connected to the inlet of the throttle valve, the outlet of the expander is connected to the inlet of the evaporator; the outlet of the engine gas pipe is connected to the thermoelectric generator, and the expander is connected to the power manager, power management The generators are respectively connected to the thermoelectric subcooler and the thermoelectric generator. The invention uses the temperature difference between the high-temperature tail gas and the ambient air to output electric energy, which is used to drive the thermoelectric supercooler and improves the utilization rate of energy.

item.title: A CO2 Automotive Air Conditioning System Based On Waste Heat and Subcooling
item.description: The invention discloses a CO2 automobile air conditioning system based on waste heat and supercooling. The CO2 automobile air conditioning system of the present invention includes a compressor, an evaporator, a gas cooler, a throttle valve, a thermoelectric generator, a thermoelectric subcooler, a thermoelectric generator and an engine; the evaporator outlet is connected to the compressor inlet, and the compressor outlet is connected to gas cooling The inlet and outlet of the gas cooler are connected to the inlet of the thermoelectric subcooler, the outlet of the thermoelectric subcooler is connected to the inlet of the throttle valve, and the outlet of the throttle valve is connected to the inlet of the evaporator; the outlet of the engine gas pipe is connected to a thermoelectric generator, and the power manager is connected to the thermoelectric subcooler respectively. And thermoelectric generator. The invention uses the temperature difference between the high-temperature tail gas and the ambient air to output electric energy, which is used to drive the thermoelectric supercooler and improves the utilization rate of energy.

item.title: Project of Tianjin University of Commerce - Research on Air Distribution Law of Cold Storage
item.description: â€¢ This project uses a combination of simulation and experiment to study the airflow field of the cold storage, mainly studying the airflow field between the fruit box and the fruit box after the fruit box is placed in the cold storage. â€¢ This project establishes a three-dimensional physical model, uses Ansys Icem CFD software for structural meshing, uses Fluent software for solving calculations, and uses Tecplot software for post-processing, and finally obtains the simulation content. â€¢ The simulation of this project mainly studies the distribution of the airflow field between the fruit bins when the apples are pre-cooled. The boundary conditions in the simulation are measured experimentally.
